title: Looking for 20th century african american type designers
author: a2z

comments.content:
I know of just one:   
Joshua Darden, although he's barely 20th century, and only half black, I think. Does it matter? :-)   
But you might find some more among the "Building Letters" guys.   
   
hhp

who are "building letters guys?"   
where would i find more info on Joshua Darden?   
thanks   
   
/aaron

thanks.   
i was hoping to find something more mid-century. this is a good start though...   
/aaron

I think it unlikely that you will find any mid-20th century black American type designers per se, but if you dug hard enough in the right places -- e.g. Harlem -- you would almost certainly turn up interesting work by local sign painters of that period, some of whom may be identifiable.

Also, dare I mention the original graffiti writers of NYC? Their distinctive writing has spawned countless imitations and cheesy fonts.   
   
(Not all of these writers were black... some where white and hispanic)   
   
(I wonder if we're supposed to accept [Mo Funky Fresh](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019153448/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.asp?pid=203876) as a "black" font?)

The funniest "Black" font is Neuland.
